job_description: Join Verition Fund Management in this exciting opportunity.

Why RTI

RTI International is an independent, scientific research institute dedicated to improving the human condition. Our vision is to address the world's most critical problems with technical and science-based solutions in pursuit of a better future. Clients rely on us to answer questions that demand an objective and multidisciplinary approach—one that integrates expertise across social, statistical, data, and laboratory sciences, engineering, and other technical disciplines to solve the world’s most challenging problems.

We believe in the promise of science and technical solutions, and we push ourselves every day to deliver on that promise for the good of people, communities, and businesses in the US and around the world. If you are looking for the opportunity to make a real difference, RTI is the place for you.


About the Hiring Group

 

RTI’s Finance Organization is seeking Financial Analyst interns to join a CFO Pricing Operations team. The Financial Analyst Intern will play a key role in supporting the Pricing team’s budget and cost proposal development processes.

 


What You'll Do

Scope of Work

This opportunity will provide experience in the RTI Finance organization as well as exposure to the Federal government contracting industry, among others. Interns will gain skills in finance, budgeting, critical thinking, problem solving, communication, and collaboration in a team environment.

 

Responsibilities      

  • Actively participate in RTI’s onboarding process to learn RTI’s financial processes and procedures.
  • Review documents to identify financial or contractual risk issues.
  • Accurately prepare budgets and financial reports in a timely manner.
  • Compile documentation to submit in business proposals to a variety of clients including federal, state and local, international, commercial, foundations, etc.
  • Update data in financial pricing software and obtain necessary reviews.
  • Collaborate with RTI pricing analysts and other cross-functional team members on a variety of proposals.
  • Research information as needed on share drives, internal websites, or other databases.
  • Perform other finance-related duties, projects, or cross-training as assigned.

Internship Learning Objectives       

  • Develop and improve skills such as critical thinking, written and verbal communication, research, technology, teamwork, leadership, and belonging.
  • Demonstrate professionalism by building integrity through strong work ethic, personal accountability, ethical behavior, and effective communication.

What You'll Need

Required Qualifications 

  • Junior or Senior currently enrolled in a 4-year university, majoring in business, finance, economics, accounting, or a related field.
  • US citizen or permanent resident.
  • Proficiency in using Microsoft Office (e.g., Adobe, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) and compiling multiple documents into a single, clearly formatted PDF volume.
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy with work.
  • Related experience and interest in government contracting, financial analysis, project management, and/or risk assessment.

Preferred Qualifications 

  • Analytical skills using financial tools such as excel, SmartView, etc.
  • Capable of working independently and with teammates.
  • Passion for continuous improvement and learning.
  • Demonstrates sound judgement.

EEO & Pay Equity Statements

For San Francisco, CA USA Job Postings Only: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Further information is available here.

 

RTI accepts applications to our job openings from candidates with criminal histories or conviction records in accordance with all applicable laws, including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

 

For Applicants in Massachusetts Only: It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

 

The anticipated pay range for this role is listed below. Our pay ranges represent national averages and may vary by location as a geographic differential may be applied to some locations within the United States. RTI considers multiple factors when making an offer including, for example: established salary range, internal budget, business needs, and education and years of work experience possessed by the applicant. Further, salary is merely one element to our offer.


At RTI, we demonstrate our commitment to rewarding individual and team achievement through a total rewards package. This package includes (among other things) a competitive base salary, a generous paid time off policy, merit based annual increases, bonus opportunities and a robust recognition program. Other benefits include a competitive range of insurance plans (including health, dental, life, and short-term and long-term disability), access to a retirement savings program such as a 401(k) plan, paid parental leave for all parents, financial assistance with adoption expenses or infertility treatments, financial reimbursement for education and developmental opportunities, an employee assistance program, and numerous other offerings to support a healthy work-life balance.


Equal Pay Act Minimum/Range

$20.00/hour

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>At CVS Health, we are focused on transforming health care for our customers and making our company a great place to work. We help people navigate the health care system – and their personal health care – by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. Within our Retail locations, we bring this promise to life with heart every day. Our 3rd year Pharmacy Interns play a critical role in supporting our pharmacy teams to consistently deliver on our brand promise, while developing their own skills in preparation for increasing responsibility.</p><p></p><p>As a 3rd year Pharmacy Intern, you will be focused on applying didactic learning from pharmacy school into real-world practice to become ready for a Pharmacist role. Under the direction of your preceptor, you will complete a comprehensive training roadmap designed to show you first-hand what it’s like to be part of a pharmacy team while gaining an overview of store, district, and regional operations. You will gain valuable hands-on experience through a training roadmap that includes a combination of Key Learning Experiences (KLEs), activities, and time spent with leaders in your district. While in the pharmacy, you will assist the pharmacy team to ensure that pharmacy operations run smoothly, our patients’ prescriptions are filled promptly, safely, and accurately, and we are providing caring service that exceeds patient expectations. You will learn to operate as part of the pharmacy team through consistent application of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), best practices, and effective communication. Throughout your shifts and in all customer and colleague interactions, you will learn to demonstrate empathy and genuine care, and contribute to a safe and inclusive culture where all people feel valued and empowered.</p><p></p><p>3rd year Pharmacy Interns are responsible for completion of a comprehensive training roadmap, focusing on KLEs that build aptitude in the following areas. As tenure increases, 3rd year Pharmacy Interns take on increasing responsibility of the safety and effectiveness of operations in the pharmacy, including but not limited to: </p><p></p><ul><li>Living our purpose by following all company SOPs at each workstation to help our Pharmacists and Technicians manage and improve patient health</li><li>Following pharmacy workflow procedures at each pharmacy workstation (i.e., production, pick-up, drive-thru, and drop-off) for safe and accurate prescription fulfillment</li><li>Contributing to positive patient experiences showing empathy and genuine care: creating heartfelt and personalized moments while serving patients at pick-up, drive-thru, and over the phone; keeping patients healthy by offering immunizations and other services at the register and over the phone; and demonstrating compassionate care by solving or escalating patient problems</li><li>Offering to counsel, fielding medical questions, and soliciting information on a patient’s medical history to provide optimal care, when appropriate under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist</li><li>Taking telephonic prescriptions from the prescriber, and calling the prescriber to clarify prescriptions or facilitate medication changes, where allowed by state regulation</li><li>Maintaining the highest level of self-awareness and providing in-the-moment coaching, training, and mentoring to pharmacy team members while sharing best practices</li><li>Completing basic inventory activities, as permitted by law, and as directed by the pharmacy leadership team, such as accurately putting away medication deliveries and completing cycle counts, returns-to-stocks, waiting bin inventories, etc.</li><li>Contributing to a high-performing team, embracing a growth mindset, and being receptive to feedback; actively seeking opportunities to expand clinical and technical knowledge needed to better assist patients</li><li>Remaining flexible for both scheduling and business needs, while contributing to a safe, inclusive, and engaging team dynamic; voluntarily traveling to stores in the market to work shifts as needed by the business</li><li>Understanding and complying with all relevant federal, state, and local laws, regulations, professional standards, and ethical principles. Complying with CVS policies and procedures to ensure patient safety, compliance with controlled substance dispensing and recordkeeping, and to protect patient privacy and security</li><li>Delivering additional patient health care services (e.g., immunizations, point-of-care testing, and voluntarily staffing offsite clinics), where allowable by law and supported by required training and certification</li></ul><p></p><p>Where permissible, the 3rd year Pharmacy Intern may also support immunizations, which includes the following responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Completing additional licensure and training requirements, in compliance with state Board of Pharmacy regulations, to obtain Technician Immunizer status to support preparing and administering vaccines</li><li>Educating patients about the importance of vaccines and referring patients to the Pharmacist-on-duty for vaccination questions</li><li>Monitoring for, and responding to, adverse reactions; reporting adverse reaction events per public health requirements</li><li>Reviewing and collecting patient information; tracking and documenting for each applicable patient</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications:</b></p><ul><li>Accepted into, or actively enrolled in, an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>Must possess, or be in the process of obtaining, valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Essential Functions:</b></p><ul><li>Regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Ability to complete required training within designated timeframe</li><li>Attention and Focus:<ul><li>Ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time</li><li>Ability to pivot quickly from one task to another to meet patient and business needs</li><li>Ability to confirm prescription information and label accuracy, ensuring patient safety</li></ul></li><li>Customer Service and Team Orientation:<ul><li>Actively look for ways to help people, and do so in a friendly manner</li><li>Notice and understand patients’ reactions, and respond appropriately</li></ul></li><li>Communication Skills:<ul><li>Use and understand verbal and written communication to interact with patients and colleagues</li><li>Utilize active listening by giving full attention to what others are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times</li></ul></li><li>Mathematical Reasoning:<ul><li>Ability to use math to solve a problem, such as determining the total number of tablets to dispense, day’s supply, and/or number of full bottles and additional bottles needed to fill a prescription</li></ul></li><li>Problem Resolution:<ul><li>Identifying challenging patient or colleague interactions and choosing the best course of action when faced multiple options</li></ul></li><li>Physical Demands:<ul><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Reach overhead; stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Move fingers repetitively; picking, pinching, typing, or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Control precision; quickly adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree, requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Occasionally lift of up to 20 lbs and/or exert up to 20 lbs. of force; Frequently lift of up to 10 lbs and/or exert up to 10 lbs. of force; Consistently lift and/or exert a negligible amount of force to move objects.</li><li>Express or exchange ideas by means of spoken word where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed accurately</li><li>; Have the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication</li></ul></li><li>Any additional tasks as directed by Supervisor or Manager</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Preferred Qualifications: </b></p><ul><li>1+ years of related work experience in pharmacy, retail, medical, or customer service setting</li><li>Ability to become immunization certified: Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li><li>Ability to work in home store, and across the market in other locations, to meet business needs</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.00 - $19.75<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/01/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>Health is everything. At CVS Health, colleagues are committed to increasing access, lowering costs, and improving quality of care. Millions of times a day, we help people on their path to better health –from advising on prescriptions to helping manage chronic and specialty conditions. As a 3rd year pharmacy intern, you have a significant role in our company working as a part of the pharmacy team– delivering our purpose, modeling our values, and demonstrating genuine, authentic care for our patients. </p><p></p><p>While working as a 3rd year pharmacy intern, under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, you play a critical role in ensuring a safe and effective Retail Pharmacy work environment that delivers exceptional care to each patient. This includes but is not limited to:</p><ul><li>Patient Safety</li><li>Pharmacy Professional Practice</li><li>Regulatory Requirements</li><li>Quality Assurance</li><li>Customer Service</li><li>Inventory Management</li><li>Workflow Management excluding final prescription verification</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Primary Roles and Responsibility: </b></p><p>A key component of the pharmacy intern role is keeping your customers and patients healthy through adoption and management of patient care programs. Additionally, you will:</p><ul><li>Lead with Heart – display empathy and compassion for your patients, customers, caregivers, and colleagues on your team</li><li>Seek new ways to grow, collaborate with others, and deliver better outcomes</li><li>Align others around our purpose to bring your heart to every moment of your health and gain support and commitment</li><li>Facilitate a team culture that promotes caring, energy, enthusiasm, and pride</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Education:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Required Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>0-3 years relevant work experience</li><li>Must possess or be in process of obtaining valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li><li>Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li>Complete all required training within state guidelines and required timeframe</li><li>Ability to:<ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Finger Dexterity: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Reach overhead; able to stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Precision control: able to adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Visual Acuity: Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Able to orally communicate information and instructions to colleagues and customers</li><li>Occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs; exerting up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects</li></ul></li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Ability To: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Complete any additional tasks as directed by supervisor or manager</li><li>Complete all required training and obtain required licensure (if applicable) within state guidelines</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Immunization eligibility</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.50 - $42.00<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 06/06/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

Throughout your shifts and in all customer and colleague interactions, you will learn to demonstrate empathy and genuine care, and contribute to a safe and inclusive culture where all people feel valued and empowered.</p><p></p><p>3rd year Pharmacy Interns are responsible for completion of a comprehensive training roadmap, focusing on KLEs that build aptitude in the following areas. As tenure increases, 3rd year Pharmacy Interns take on increasing responsibility of the safety and effectiveness of operations in the pharmacy, including but not limited to: </p><p></p><ul><li>Living our purpose by following all company SOPs at each workstation to help our Pharmacists and Technicians manage and improve patient health</li><li>Following pharmacy workflow procedures at each pharmacy workstation (i.e., production, pick-up, drive-thru, and drop-off) for safe and accurate prescription fulfillment</li><li>Contributing to positive patient experiences showing empathy and genuine care: creating heartfelt and personalized moments while serving patients at pick-up, drive-thru, and over the phone; keeping patients healthy by offering immunizations and other services at the register and over the phone; and demonstrating compassionate care by solving or escalating patient problems</li><li>Offering to counsel, fielding medical questions, and soliciting information on a patient’s medical history to provide optimal care, when appropriate under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist</li><li>Taking telephonic prescriptions from the prescriber, and calling the prescriber to clarify prescriptions or facilitate medication changes, where allowed by state regulation</li><li>Maintaining the highest level of self-awareness and providing in-the-moment coaching, training, and mentoring to pharmacy team members while sharing best practices</li><li>Completing basic inventory activities, as permitted by law, and as directed by the pharmacy leadership team, such as accurately putting away medication deliveries and completing cycle counts, returns-to-stocks, waiting bin inventories, etc.</li><li>Contributing to a high-performing team, embracing a growth mindset, and being receptive to feedback; actively seeking opportunities to expand clinical and technical knowledge needed to better assist patients</li><li>Remaining flexible for both scheduling and business needs, while contributing to a safe, inclusive, and engaging team dynamic; voluntarily traveling to stores in the market to work shifts as needed by the business</li><li>Understanding and complying with all relevant federal, state, and local laws, regulations, professional standards, and ethical principles. Complying with CVS policies and procedures to ensure patient safety, compliance with controlled substance dispensing and recordkeeping, and to protect patient privacy and security</li><li>Delivering additional patient health care services (e.g., immunizations, point-of-care testing, and voluntarily staffing offsite clinics), where allowable by law and supported by required training and certification</li></ul><p></p><p>Where permissible, the 3rd year Pharmacy Intern may also support immunizations, which includes the following responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Completing additional licensure and training requirements, in compliance with state Board of Pharmacy regulations, to obtain Technician Immunizer status to support preparing and administering vaccines</li><li>Educating patients about the importance of vaccines and referring patients to the Pharmacist-on-duty for vaccination questions</li><li>Monitoring for, and responding to, adverse reactions; reporting adverse reaction events per public health requirements</li><li>Reviewing and collecting patient information; tracking and documenting for each applicable patient</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications:</b></p><ul><li>Accepted into, or actively enrolled in, an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>Must possess, or be in the process of obtaining, valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Essential Functions:</b></p><ul><li>Regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Ability to complete required training within designated timeframe</li><li>Attention and Focus:<ul><li>Ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time</li><li>Ability to pivot quickly from one task to another to meet patient and business needs</li><li>Ability to confirm prescription information and label accuracy, ensuring patient safety</li></ul></li><li>Customer Service and Team Orientation:<ul><li>Actively look for ways to help people, and do so in a friendly manner</li><li>Notice and understand patients’ reactions, and respond appropriately</li></ul></li><li>Communication Skills:<ul><li>Use and understand verbal and written communication to interact with patients and colleagues</li><li>Utilize active listening by giving full attention to what others are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times</li></ul></li><li>Mathematical Reasoning:<ul><li>Ability to use math to solve a problem, such as determining the total number of tablets to dispense, day’s supply, and/or number of full bottles and additional bottles needed to fill a prescription</li></ul></li><li>Problem Resolution:<ul><li>Identifying challenging patient or colleague interactions and choosing the best course of action when faced multiple options</li></ul></li><li>Physical Demands:<ul><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Reach overhead; stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Move fingers repetitively; picking, pinching, typing, or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Control precision; quickly adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree, requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Occasionally lift of up to 20 lbs and/or exert up to 20 lbs. of force; Frequently lift of up to 10 lbs and/or exert up to 10 lbs. of force; Consistently lift and/or exert a negligible amount of force to move objects.</li><li>Express or exchange ideas by means of spoken word where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed accurately</li><li>; Have the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication</li></ul></li><li>Any additional tasks as directed by Supervisor or Manager</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Preferred Qualifications: </b></p><ul><li>1+ years of related work experience in pharmacy, retail, medical, or customer service setting</li><li>Ability to become immunization certified: Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li><li>Ability to work in home store, and across the market in other locations, to meet business needs</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.00 - $19.75<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/08/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

<p>O’Reilly’s Summer Internship Program is an in-person, 10-week, paid, summer program that offers students the opportunity to work closely with experienced leaders and professionals in different departments and to showcase their knowledge by providing recommendations and feedback. Throughout the internship, students will build upon their current skillsets, while applying their education to meaningful, impactful projects.</p><p></p><p>Interns will be paired with one department for the summer and will be responsible for assisting their team with special projects and daily tasks that will contribute to the success of the company. Along with a mentor, interns will design their Career Development Plan and complete tasks and projects to gain the experience necessary to achieve their career goals.</p><p></p><p><b>What You Will Gain:</b></p><p>A <span>broad understanding of O'Reilly's HR functions by rotating through 10+ Human Resources teams</span></p><p>Ownership over a meaningful project and/or tasks that will challenge you to leave a lasting impact on O’Reilly</p><p>A personalized Career Development Plan with the guidance of your mentor</p><p>Intern Cohort: complete the program as part of a tight-knit group of interns supporting & learning from each other</p><p>Gain exclusive industry knowledge with site visits to our stores and distribution centers</p><p>Professional development curriculum with events hosted by experienced professionals</p><p>Build connections with O’Reilly team members and fellow interns through social events and activities</p><p>Expert education on translating your internship experience to your future job search</p><p></p><p>Below is a list of things we’d like to see in candidates for this internship. However, above all else, we are looking for the right PERSON for the job. Our ideal intern is <b>hardworking</b>, <b>enthusiastic </b>to learn and use new skills, <b>dedicated</b> to always doing their best, excited to <b>contribute to a culture of teamwork</b>, and committed to approaching their work with a <b>win-win attitude</b> to help everyone succeed.</p><p></p><p><b>We’d Love to Hear From Students Who:</b></p><p><a href="https://careers.oreillyauto.com/us/en/culture" target="_blank">See themselves in O’Reilly’s 12 Culture Values</a></p><p>Are actively enrolled at an accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or a related field</p><p>Are entering their junior or senior year of college (minimum 60 completed credit hours), or be a graduate student</p><p>Participate in on or off-campus activities outside of the classroom</p><p>Excellent communicators, both verbal and written</p><p>Passionate about contributing to and being a part of a positive culture based on win-win attitudes</p><p>Contribute to their local community through community outreach, service projects, etc.</p><p>Ability to work full-time (40 hours) for 10 weeks during summer</p><p style="text-align:left">O’Reilly Auto Parts has a proven track record of growth and stability. O’Reilly is full of successful career stories and believes in a strong promote-from-within philosophy, encouraging you to grow your career along with the organization. </p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Total Compensation Package:</b></p><ul><li><p style="text-align:left">Competitive Wages & Paid Time Off</p></li><li><p style="text-align:left">Stock Purchase Plan & 401k with Employer Contributions Starting Day One</p></li><li><p style="text-align:left">Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance with Optional Flexible Spending Account (FSA)</p></li><li><p style="text-align:left">Team Member Health/Wellbeing Programs</p></li><li><p style="text-align:left">Tuition Educational Assistance Programs</p></li><li><p style="text-align:left">Opportunities for Career Growth</p></li></ul><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><i>O’Reilly Auto Parts is an equal opportunity employer. </i><i><span>The Company does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin or ancestry (including immigration status or citizenship), sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions,) age (40 and over), veteran status, uniformed service member status, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing or characteristics) or another protected status as defined by local, state, or federal law, as applicable.</span></i></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><i>Qualified individuals with a disability may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act. If you require a reasonable accommodation during the application or employment process, please send an email to: </i><a href="mailto:rar@oreillyauto.com" target="_blank"><i><span>rar@oreillyauto.com</span></i></a><i> or call (800) 471-7431 option , and provide your requested accommodation, and position details. </i></p>

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>Health is everything. At CVS Health, colleagues are committed to increasing access, lowering costs, and improving quality of care. Millions of times a day, we help people on their path to better health –from advising on prescriptions to helping manage chronic and specialty conditions. As a 3rd year pharmacy intern, you have a significant role in our company working as a part of the pharmacy team– delivering our purpose, modeling our values, and demonstrating genuine, authentic care for our patients. </p><p></p><p>While working as a 3rd year pharmacy intern, under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, you play a critical role in ensuring a safe and effective Retail Pharmacy work environment that delivers exceptional care to each patient. This includes but is not limited to:</p><ul><li>Patient Safety</li><li>Pharmacy Professional Practice</li><li>Regulatory Requirements</li><li>Quality Assurance</li><li>Customer Service</li><li>Inventory Management</li><li>Workflow Management excluding final prescription verification</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Primary Roles and Responsibility: </b></p><p>A key component of the pharmacy intern role is keeping your customers and patients healthy through adoption and management of patient care programs. Additionally, you will:</p><ul><li>Lead with Heart – display empathy and compassion for your patients, customers, caregivers, and colleagues on your team</li><li>Seek new ways to grow, collaborate with others, and deliver better outcomes</li><li>Align others around our purpose to bring your heart to every moment of your health and gain support and commitment</li><li>Facilitate a team culture that promotes caring, energy, enthusiasm, and pride</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Education:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Required Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>0-3 years relevant work experience</li><li>Must possess or be in process of obtaining valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li><li>Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li>Complete all required training within state guidelines and required timeframe</li><li>Ability to:<ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Finger Dexterity: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Reach overhead; able to stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Precision control: able to adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Visual Acuity: Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Able to orally communicate information and instructions to colleagues and customers</li><li>Occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs; exerting up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects</li></ul></li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Ability To: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Complete any additional tasks as directed by supervisor or manager</li><li>Complete all required training and obtain required licensure (if applicable) within state guidelines</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Immunization eligibility</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.50 - $42.00<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 06/01/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

Description

At CDW, we make it happen, together. Trust, connection, and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers. It’s why we’re coworkers, not just employees. Coworkers who genuinely believe in supporting our customers and one another. We collectively forge our path forward with a level of commitment that speaks to who we are and where we’re headed. We’re proud to share our story and Make Amazing Happen at CDW.

Are you ready to launch your sales career? Join CDW’s Summer Sales Internship Program and gain hands-on experience in business-to-business technology sales. Work alongside top-performing sales professionals, learn solution-based selling strategies, and access 1,000+ leading technology brands - all while building a nationwide network of peers.

What You’ll Do
• Contribute to strategic projects that impact our sales organization
• Research new and inactive accounts to uncover opportunities
• Develop skills in building rapport with customers through outbound phone calls
• Shadow experienced sellers and collaborate on targeted campaigns
• Partner with mentors and buddies to sharpen sales and professional skills
• Analyze segment-specific data to support territory optimization
• Engage with vendor partners and cross-functional teams to understand CDW’s business model

How You’ll Grow

Over 10 weeks, you’ll gain hands-on experience in technology sales through classroom training, real-world projects, and ongoing coaching from your Sales Manager. Your journey begins with a week-long orientation in Chicago, where you’ll connect with fellow interns, meet CDW leaders, and dive into our culture and sales fundamentals. Throughout the program, you’ll also take part in professional development activities + executive panels, workshops, and volunteer events - designed to prepare you for a potential full-time sales career.

Program Details

The 2026 Summer Internship Program runs will begin on Tuesday, June 2nd through Friday, August 7th and offers a hybrid work experience in the location listed in the job description.

What We’re Looking For
• Currently enrolled undergraduate students with a graduation date of December 2026 or May 2027 with ability to begin full-time employment in 2027 (if offered employment post-internship)
• Passion for a career in sales and a self-starter mindset
• Strong interpersonal and time management skills
• Ability to commit to a 40-hour work week during standard business hours throughout the summer, with a hybrid work arrangement
• Authorization to work in the U.S. without sponsorship as a full-time coworker

Salary: $18/hour
Benefits overview: https://cdw.benefit-info.com/
Salary ranges may be subject to geographic differentials 

We make technology work so people can do great things.    

CDW is a leading multi-brand provider of information technology solutions to business, government, education and healthcare customers in the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada. A Fortune 500 company and member of the S&P 500 Index, CDW helps its customers to navigate an increasingly complex IT market and maximize return on their technology investments. Together, we unite. Together, we win. Together, we thrive.

CDW is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by state and local law.     

CDW is committed to fostering an equitable, transparent, and respectful hiring process for all applicants. During our application process, CDW’s goal is to get to know you as an applicant and understand your experience, strengths, skills, and qualifications. While AI can help you present yourself more clearly and effectively, the essence of your application should be authentically yours. To learn more, please review CDW's AI Applicant Notice.

The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Arlington, VA. </p><p></p><p>We’re offering an exciting opportunity for first-year law students to gain hands-on experience in both corporate and law firm settings through our Summer 2026 Legal Internship Program. This 10-week program includes six weeks at a leading Connecticut law firm and four weeks with RTX’s corporate legal team, giving you the chance to explore both in-house and private practice environments. As an intern, you’ll work on meaningful legal tasks such as research, analysis, writing, and supporting client matters, all while building valuable skills and connections to help launch your legal career.</p><p></p><p><b>What You Will Do</b></p><ul><li>Work 40 hours per week and be available onsite for the full 10 weeks of the internship program.</li><li>Receive specific assignments tailored to your interests and availability.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Qualifications You Must Have</b></p><ul><li>Completion of at least one year of law school with a minimum 3.0 GPA (please include your academic transcript with your application).</li><li>Demonstrated interest in and plans to work in Connecticut.</li><li>Ability to work in Connecticut throughout the summer internship.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office and familiarity with basic digital tools.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Qualifications We Prefer</b></p><ul><li>Previous experience in a legal setting.</li><li>A minimum GPA of 3.2.</li></ul><p></p><p><b>What We Offer</b></p><p>Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.</p><p></p><p><b>Learn More & Apply Now!</b></p><p>This position is classified as <b>onsite</b>. Please ensure this role type (defined below) is appropriate for your needs before applying to this role. Candidates will learn more about role type and current site status throughout the recruiting process.</p><p></p><p><b>Onsite</b>: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite.</p><p></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><i><b>As part of our commitment to maintaining a secure hiring process, candidates may be asked to attend select steps of the interview process in-person at one of our office locations, regardless of whether the role is designated as on-site, hybrid or remote.</b></i></p><p></p>The salary range for this role is 37,000 USD - 82,000 USD. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement.
